description.narrative: Focus states/ LGAs have increased capacity and deliver services to ensure children and women have sustained and equitable access to improved water sources., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, vulnerable children and their families have equitable access to and use sustainable improved water sources, improved sanitation facilities and practice safe hygiene.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Focus states/ LGAs have increased capacity and deliver services to ensure children and women have sustained and equitable access to improved water sources.

description.narrative: In 2017, 2.2 million people gained access to improved water services. Community level water safety planning aimed at safeguarding water quality at the community level was scaled up in 3,665 communities across 58 LGAs while Village Level Operation and Maintenance (VLOM) system was instituted in 64 LGAs across 16 states. | Status:Met | As-of Date:16/01/2018

title.narrative: Proportion of people accessing basic drinking water during the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support.

% increase in the functionality of water facilities in project LGAs
Existence of a national plan with target to provide access to drinking water to unserved populations
